data.title: Load up your bowl and watch it cooked before your eyes
data.text: This is a fun spot.  You pick a bowl (3 sizes available) and then fill it up with your choices of meats, seafood, and veggies.  Pick your favorite sauce to go on top.  Then hand it all to the chef who will cook it all up on the grill and then deliver the result to you on top of your choice of three kinds of rice or noodles.  Its all fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced.  The servers are very friendly and the place is very informal.

data.title: If you don't like it, it's all on you!
data.text: I'd never eaten at a Ghengis Grill before. It was delicious. My recipe, their chefs. How could it go wrong. If you don't like it, it's all on you.

data.title: Interesting place to eat
data.text: You pick your bowl size then fill it with your meat and veggie choices, then they stir fry for you, lots of choices for meat and veggies, hard to cram in bowl and lots of sauces to pick from as well. I like that they also have a bar. Stormchaser says try it out

data.title: You pick the food yourself
data.text: It is yummy as you pick it. I would caution that is you have food allergies not to visit. All sauces have gluten and they mix along side other food. But it was hot and cheap. Also has a bar.

data.title: Something Different
data.text:
If I had of know what to put together it probably would have been better. I was there because of my Grandsons 
Graduation and never had eaten at a do it yourself Asian place. I love Asian food, but did not know what spices and so forth to use. I added salt and shouldn't have, and the rice was sticky so I guess I should have added more juice.  I will try it again if the occasion happens.

data.title: Good service
data.text: Same as other Ghengis grills except cleaner.  You choose your veggies, proteins, starch and sauces. You can flavor with various spices.  Prices are a bit high for small appetites but I like this place.

data.title: Good place to eat at.
data.text: The staff is friendly and helpful, but as far as food combinations go, i hope you have a good taste and sense of food or what ever bowl you create might be a mess! As long as you know what you know what you are doing and mix the right ingredients you shouldn't have a problem.

data.title: Tons of great food stuffed into a bowl
data.text: Purchase the large bowl. Cram in as much of the tasty fresh food items as you can into your bowl. Watch the chefs grill your meal like Pros. Excellent food made the way you want it. Why the large bowl? It's just too good (food) and it gives you leftovers for the next day.

data.title: Good Food, poor service!
data.text: We have eaten at several other Ghengis Grills, so we knew what to expect.  The food was as good as you create it.  The restaurant was not very busy when we ate here, but the service left much to be desired. Our waitress apparently forgot we were there - had to find someone to get drinks refilled, and then had to search for her to get the check.  The wait staff was more interested in talking with themselves that to pay attention to the customers!

data.title: enjoyed every bite
data.text: This was my first time here despite living in BCS for over 2 years and I am kicking myself for not going sooner. There are not a lot of good Asian choices in around and I would go as far as to say this was the best Asian bowl I have had in BCS. The food is extremely fresh and the self service area clean and well maintained. They have so many delicious sauces its hard to decide. The Brownies are ooey gooey goodness and are to die for.

data.title: Nice with good value
data.text: this concept is overused in my opinion but they have tried hard to make it special with service. Food is what you would expect, seating good, and service works very hard.

data.title: This place rocks!
data.text:
Fresh selection of proteins,  vegetables and a large selection of sauces. 
The chicken was fresh and tender, as was the beef. Also, had the choice of pork, sausage, seafood, which included scallops, shrimp and calamari.  Lots of vegetables to choose from too.
I ordered the regular size bowl, but could have just gotten the small. Portions are large.
The service was great too. Food came out fast and hot.
We had the tuxedo bomb dessert, all I can say is YUM!
Worth the stop. Will be back again.

data.title: Nice selection
data.text: Liked the several selections offered for the meals. Tasty and quick service.  Priced nicely - not too expensive.

data.title: Very nice concept with handpicking your own meal
data.text: The concept of the meal is very entertaining. You pick out the size bowl you want and then stack whatever proteins, vegetables, spices, starch and sauce(s) you want. They combine it all and cook it on a large, round flattop grill basically in front of you. Each time I go, I try different combinations of everything and I love it every time. There are a few coupons that come out every month which are the way to go when dining at Ghengis Grill!

data.title: Good food, fun fie the kids!
data.text: The food was cooked as well and served fast despite crowd. The kids lived making their own bowls and picking what they wanted. Friendly service! Nice atmosphere!

data.title: Great atmosphere and food
data.text: Although a little pricy, the food is very good. The idea of compiling your own starch, meats, vegetables, and sauces is great, and for those who may be a little confused on what to get, there are sample recipes to follow. Altogether a great dining experience with good service.

data.title: Great!
data.text: Highly recommend this. You pile up how much meat and veggies you can in a bowl, choose your rice, then they cook it for you.  It's delish!

data.title: Undercooked Seafood.  Good Save by Staff
data.text:
Went here for dinner after work.  I had a bowl with shrimp, squid, scallops, and "crab".  I picked the other ingredients and waited for my dish.  After a few bites, I noticed that some of the seafood ingredients were undercooked!

I picked at the rice and veggies until my server came back.  I told her about the issue, and she offered to go through for a new bowl, but I thought it best just to take everything back and just cook it a little longer.  It tasted okay.  No problems after that.

Kudos to my server ASHLEY, who was patient with me through the selection process, and in getting my order fixed.  If not for the initial cooking snafu, I'd have given a better rating.  If not for Ashley's help, I'd have given a worse rating.

I may go back.  After a long day of mental stress at work, I wasn't really in the mood to select and build my dish from the ground up.  I'll try again after a less-stressful day, and keep a better eye on how the seafood is cooked.

data.title: As always
data.text: Been to several all over Texas, but this one packed in the rice. WE were full before you ever saw a dent in our bowl. Had enough for lunch, and dinner for 2 out of the med bowl.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: This is the first time I have eaten here and I love the food.  Service was a little slow but we were all talking and visiting.  I will and want to go back.
